column4: mbruemer> you would probably need 5gb max for comfort...but more is better
mbruemer> i left ubuntu approx 12 gb after setting up new hard drive and leaving freespace
mbruemer>depends on if you are doing server install and do not plan on using a gui or desktop environment
I think the larger numbers are for if you are going to be saving large files as well...I mean amany people use ubuntu and plain linux as entertainment jukeboxes...
mbruemer> I have 256 w/Athlon 1.2ghz...and I'm thinking of getting more memory...however if you opt for xfce as desktop you would be ebtter off with lower ram
I don't think you mean what you just said. Even with xfce, more memory is better.
that's what I thought you meant... I concur with that.
yes, it's called dyspraxia.
you have a tractor?
sold it. Was very nice, though, 800cc single cylinder, 16 hp... #ubuntu-offtopic?
I bought it because of the label... Porsche.
was it a Deerie?
Porsche!
yeah they started making farm equipment
they had a factory by Lake Constance where they built these smart little machines.
was it fullgrown or one of those lawntractor wannabes?
it weighed 800kg, so I guess that's the first category up from a lawn tractor :)
I enjoyed the read anyway ;)
don't applaud...throw money...<s>
you mean reinstall?
no, first line is reboot ;)
LSD abuse maybe. It was discovered at Hoffman Laroche.
ahh...was a little tidbit I saw on Space TV today...you can't believe everything you see on tv I guess...lol
